revised_title: Simultaneous Thermometric and Hygrometric Observations at Heights of 4 and 170 Feet, and of Siemens' Electrical Thermometer at 260 Feet above the Ground
tldr: The author describes a series of thermometric and hygrometric observations conducted at different heights above the ground, using various instruments such as dry and wet bulb thermometers and Siemens' electrical thermometers. The study aims to understand the influence of height on temperature and humidity readings and the shape of the daily temperature curve at considerable heights.
